author: sky.cactus
content: It depends entirely on usage demands.  It is possible that no matter how much "scaling" we add, there will always be more latent demand waiting to use more blockspace.

author: sky.cactus
content: We have seen this with hard drive capacity, computing power, energy generation, etc. where humanity gets better at producing more of a thing, but at the same time it also demands more of the thing.

author: liberosist
content:
Possible, I estimate a target of ~20 gwei post-Merge for 0% inflation (better estimates after 1559, observing where the priority:base ratio settles). We've seen these gas prices in the last couple of months when speculative activity subsides. Curiously, the 7D MA gas price bottomed out at around 20 gwei and is on the rise again. 

There could be short periods where we fall below this target, but in the long term there'll very likely be higher demand induced by low fees, as Micah says above. We'll see new usecases and applications emerge on rollups that weren't possible on L1.
